p: Richardson et al. (2020) reported in their study that apple contains multiple vitamins including vitamin C, E, Î²-carotene and essential mineral elements such as calcium, iron, potassium, manganese, zinc, magnesium, copper, and sulfur [ 73]. Vitamin C is also a strong antioxidant, and the amount present in 100 g of apple is 5.7 mg [ 2]. The mineral content mg per 100 g apple are K (107.25), Ca (5.80), P (10.87), Mg (5.07), Na (0.72), Fe (0.123), Zn (0.043), Cu (0.027), and Mn (0.035) [ 74].
